episode_title: 120 - The One With the Evil Orthodontist

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you would actually say that. I would much rather be Mr.Peanut than Mr.Salty.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! Mr.Salty is a sailor, all right, he’s got to be, like, thetoughest snack there is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, you don’t wanna mess with corn nuts. They’re craaazy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. You guys! You gotta come see this! There’s some creep out there with a telescope!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe it! He’s looking right at us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that is so sick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I feel violated. And not in a good way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How can people do that?… (All but Phoebe walk away from the window in disgust.) Oh, you guys, look! Ugly Naked Guy got gravity boots!

content.description: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am telling you, years from now, schoolchildren will study it as one of the greatest first dates of all time. It was unbelievable! We could totally be ourselves, we didn’t have to play any games…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So have you called her yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let her know I like her? What are you, insane? (The girls make disgusted noises.) It’s the next day! How needy do I want to seem? (To the guys) I’m right, right?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah. Let her dangle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe my parents are actually pressuring me to find one of you people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, God, just do it! (Grabbing the phone.) Call her! Stop being so testosteroney!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which, by the way, is the real San Francisco treat. (Calls her, then hurriedly hangs up.) I got her machine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Her answer machine?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, interestingly enough her leaf blower picked up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, uh, why didn’t you say anything?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no-no-no-no. Last time I left a spontaneous message I ended up using the phrase “Yes indeedy-o.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look look! It’s Rachel and Barry. No, don’t everybody look at once!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, they’re just talking…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well, does he look upset? Does he look like he was just told to shove anything?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no actually, he’s smiling.. and… Oh my God, don’t do that!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What? What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That man across the street just kicked that pigeon! (Rachel enters.) Oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And basically, that’s how a bill becomes a law.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!… Right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Rach!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’d it go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, it was, uh.. it was actually really great. He took me to lunch at the Russian Tea Room , and I had that chicken, where y’know you poke it and all the butter squirts out…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not a good day for birds…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then we took a walk down to Bendall’s , and I told him not to, but he got me a little bottle of Chanel …

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s nice… now, was that before or after you told him to stop calling, stop sending you flowers and to generally leave you alone, hmm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right,.. well,.. we never actually got to that… Oh, it was just so nice to see him again, y’know? It was comfortable, it was familiar… it was just nice!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s, that’s nice twice!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, what’s going on? I mean isn’t this the same Barry who you left at the altar?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Duh, where’ve you been?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but it was different with him today! And he wasn’t, like, Orthodontist Guy, y’know? I mean, we had fun! Is there anything wrong with that?
(Ross ‘prompts’ Chandler by hitting him on the arm.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have my reasons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, how about the fact that he’s engaged to another woman, who just happens to be your ex-best friend?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. All right, all right, all right, all right, I know it’s stupid! I will go see him this afternoon, and I will just put an end to it!

content.description: Barry’s Office, the post-coital Barry and Rachel are recovering on the chair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow… Wow!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not crazy, right? I mean, it was never like that.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Nooo, it wasn’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, and it’s so nice having this little sink here…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there except Rachel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, Danielle! I wasn’t expecting the machine… Give me a call when you get a chance. (Rattles some dishes) Bye-bye. (Hangs up.) Oh God!
content.parenthetical: on phone, reading from a script

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s what you’ve been working on for the past two hours?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I’ve been honing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What was with the dishes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, uh.. I want her to think I might be in a restaurant.. y’know? I might have some kind of life, like I haven’t been sitting around here honing for the past few hours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look look! He’s doing it again, the guy with the telescope!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! (Walks to the window) Go away! (Gesturing.) Stop looking in here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great, now he’s waving back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, we gotta do something about that guy. This morning, I caught him looking into our apartment. It creeps me out! I feel like I can’t do stuff!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What kinda stuff?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you grow up? I’m not talking about sexy stuff, but, like, when I’m cooking naked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You cook naked?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, toast, oatmeal… nothing that spatters.
(A pause as they look at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you looking at me for? I didn’t know that.

content.description: Barry’s Office, Rachel and Barry are getting married.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s just… Oh, Barry, this was not good.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: No, it was. It was very very good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what about Mindy?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Oh, way, way better than Mindy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, not that, I mean, what about you and Mindy?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Well, if you want, I’ll just—I’ll just break it off with her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No-no-no-no, no. I mean, don’t do that. Not, I mean not for me.

content.speaker: Bernice
content.text: Dr. Farber, Bobby Rush is here for his adjustment.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Thanks, Bernice. (To Rachel) Let’s go away this weekend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Barry..! Come on, this is all way too..

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: We can, we can go to Aruba! When I went there on what would have been our honeymoon, it was, uh… it was really nice. You would’ve liked it.
(Pause as Rachel realises…)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I had a bra.
(Barry finds it draped on a cupboard and gives it to Rachel, they kiss as Bobby enters.)

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: Hey, Dr. Farber.
(Rachel and Barry quickly split and pretend Barry is examining Rachel’s mouth.)

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: All right Miss Green, everything looks fine… Yep, I think we’re starting to see some real progress here.
(Bobby looks on, deadpan.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Bobby
content.text: I’m twelve, I’m not stupid.
(Rachel glares at him.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler enters clutching his phone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I use your phone?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.. uh, but for future reference, that thing in your hand can also be used as a phone.
(Chandler dials his own phone and it rings.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, it’s working! Why isn’t she calling me back?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe she never got your message.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, if you want, you can call her machine, and if she has a lot of beeps, that means she probably didn’t get her messages yet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’don’t think that makes me seem a little…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …desperate, needy, pathetic?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, you obviously saw my personal ad.
(He calls and quickly hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How many beeps?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She answered.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’see, this is where you’d use that ‘hello’ word we talked about.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not gonna talk to her, she obviously got my message and is choosing not to call me. Now I’m needy and snubbed. God, I miss just being needy.
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How’d he take it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pretty well, actually… (Wandering into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, Rach… how come you have dental floss in your hair?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, do I?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We ended up having sex in his chair.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You had sex in his chair ?!… I said that a little too loudly, didn’t I?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You-you had what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sex in his chair.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, uh… what were you thinking?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know! I mean, we still care about each other. There’s a history there. ’s’like you and Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No no, it is nothing like me and Carol!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please. If she said to you, “Ross, I want you on this couch, right here, right now,” what would you say?
(Ross flounders.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If it helps, I could slide over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s, it’s, it’s, uh, a totally diferent situation! It’s, it’s apples and oranges, it’s, it’s orthodontists and lesbi- I gotta go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where are you going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just have to go, all right? Do I need a reason? Huh? I mean I have things to do with my life, I have a jam packed schedule, and I am late- for keeping up with it. Okay?
(Ross exits, a phone rings, and Chandler dives for his phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello? Hello?
(Rachel picks up their phone and the ringing stops. As she talks on the phone, an elaborate visual gag is spun out which is too difficult to describe in words.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello?(Listens) Mindy! Hi! Hey, how are you? (Listens) Yes, yes, I’ve heard, congratulations, that is so great. (Listens) Really? (Listens) Oh. (Listens) Okay. Okay, well I’m working tomorrow, but if you want you can, you can, you can come by and… (Listens) Okay… (Listens) Great… (Listens) Great… (Listens) All right, so I’ll, so I’ll see you tomorrow! (Listens) Okay.. (Listens) Okay… (Listens) Bye. (Hangs up and sits down heavily.) Oh God. Oh God. Oh God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So how’s Mindy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, she wants to see me tomorrow…Oh, she sounded really weird, I gotta call Barry… (Does so, on phone) Hi, it’s me, I just.. Mindy!! Mindy! Hi! No, I figured that’s where you’d be!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning. Chandler is sitting and staring at his phone. Monica enters and creeps up next to Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Brrrrrrr!
(Chandler clutches at his phone before realising.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hell is filled with people like you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s back! The peeper’s back!
(Rachel enters from her room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get down!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get down?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …And boogie!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks, but I gotta go to work and get my eyes scratched out by Mindy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Relax. Y’know, she may not even know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please. I haven’t heard from her in seven months, and now she calls me? I mean, what else is it about? Oh! She was my best friend, you guys! We went to camp together… she taught me how to kiss..

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And now, y’know, I’m like… I’m like the other woman! I feel so..

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ..Naughty!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right, I’ll see you guys later…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hold up, I’ll walk out with you. Now, Rach, when she taught you to kiss, you were at camp, and.. were you wearing any kinda little uniform, or- (Rachel exits and slams the door in his face.) That’s fine, yeah…
(Joey exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna go to the bathroom. Will you watch my phone?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just take it with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, we haven’t been on a second date, she needs to hear me pee?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just call her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t call her, I left a message! I have some pride.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! (Calls) Danielle, hi! It’s, uh, it’s Chandler! (Listens) I’m fine. Uh, listen, I don’t know if you tried to call me, because, uh, idiot that I am, I accidentally shut off my phone. (Listens) Oh, uh, okay, that’s fine, that’s great. (Listens) Okay. (Puts down the phone.) (to Monica) She’s on the other line, she’s gonna call me back. (He starts doing a little jig.) She’s on the other line, she’s gonna call me back, she’s on the other line, gonna call me back…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t you have to pee?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’s’why I’m dancing…

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is serving coffee as Mindy enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mindy.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Hey, you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, you… So, what’s up?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Um.. we should really be sitting for this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure we should… So.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Now, I know things’ve been weird lately, but you’re like my oldest friend in the world… Except for maybe Laurie Schaffer, who I don’t talk to anywhere, ’cause she’s all bitter now that she lost the weight and it turns out she doesn’t have a pretty face. …Okay, I’m just gonna ask you this once, and I want a straight answer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Will you be my maid of honour?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Of course!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Oh that’s so great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Was that all you wanted to ask me?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: That’s all!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh!! (Mindy starts to sob.) …What? What?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: That’s not all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh sure it is!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Oh no, it isn’t! No! I think Barry is seeing someone in the city.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, what- what would make you think that?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Well, ever since we announced the engagement, he’s been acting really weird, and then last night, he came home smelling like Chanel .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really. Mindy, if it’ll make you feel any better, when I was engaged to him he went through a whole weird thing too.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Oh God! You see, that’s what I was afraid of!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What’s what you were afraid of?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Okay, okay… when Barry was engaged to you, he and I…kind of… had a little thing on the side.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: I know. I know, and when he proposed to me, everyone said “Don’t do it, he’s just gonna do to you what he did to Rachel,” and now I feel so stupid.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh… Oh, Mindy, you are so stupid. Oh, we are both so stupid.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Smell familiar?
content.parenthetical: offers her arm to Mindy and she sniffs

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: No me, I am so sorry…
(They hug and Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Ross are doing a crossword, Monica is cooking, and Chandler is still staring at his phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Four letters: “Circle or hoop”.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ring dammit, ring!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you know our phone’s not working?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I tried to call you from the coffee shop, and there was no answer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I turned it off. Mother of God, I turned it off!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just like you told her you did! (Chandler glares at her.) … Just pointing out the irony.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, so listen, I went across the street and talked to the doorman- I got the peeper’s name! Can I use the phone?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nngghhh!!!!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I use your phone? (On phone) Yeah, the number for a Sidney Marks, please.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: “Heating device.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Radiator.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Five letters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rdtor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, is Sidney there? (Listens) Oh, this is? (To the gang) Sidney’s a woman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So she’s a woman! So what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, so what? (On phone) Look, I live across the street, (walking to the window) and I know all about you and your little telescope, and I don’t appreciate it, okay? (Listens) Yeah, I can see you right now! (Listens) Hello! (Listens) If I wanna walk around my apartment in my underwear, I shouldn’t have to feel like—(Listens)—Thank you, but… that’s not really the point… (Listens) The point is that… (Listens) Mostly free weights, but occasionally..

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, my neighbor… (Listens) Yeah, the brunette… (to Monica) She says you looked very pretty the other day in the green dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The green dress? Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she said you looked like Ingrid Bergman that day.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo!

content.description: Barry’s Office, Barry is preparing his tools alone as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. Got a second?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Sure, sure. Come on… (Mindy enters) …in…

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Hello, sweetheart.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Uh… uh… what’re’you… what’re’you guys doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, we are here to break up with you.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Both of you?

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Basically, we think you’re a horrible human being, and bad things should happen to you.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: I’m sorry… I’m sorry, God, I am so sorry, I’m an idiot, I was weak, I couldn’t help myself! Whatever I did, I only did because I love you so much!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh- which one of us are you talking to there, Barr?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: …Mindy. Mindy, of course Mindy, it was always Mindy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Even when we were having sex in that chair?

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: I swear, whatever I was doing, I was always thinking of you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please! During that second time you couldn’t have picked her out of a lineup!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: You did it twice?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, the first time didn’t really count… I mean, y’know, ’s’Barry.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Okay…

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Sweetheart, just gimme- gimme another chance, okay, we’ll start all over again. We’ll go back to Aruba.

content.speaker: Bernice
content.text: Dr. Farber, we’ve got a bit of an emergency here…Jason Costalano is choking on his retainer.

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Oh God… (Into intercom) I’ll be right there, Bernice. (to Mindy) Look, please, please don’t go anywhere, okay? I’ll be, I’ll be right back.
(Barry exits)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay, we’ll be here! Hating you! Did you see how he was sweating when he walked out of there? Listen honey, if I’m hogging the ball too much you just jump right in there and take a couple punches because I’m telling you, this feels great .

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Yeah… I’m pretty sure I’m still gonna marry him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you talking about?! Mindy, the guy is the devil! He’s Satan in a smock!

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: Look, I know he’s not perfect, but the truth is, at the end of the day, I still really wanna be Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber, D.D.S.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Mindy
content.text: I hope you can find some way to be happy for me. And I hope you’ll still be my maid of honor…?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I hope Barry doesn’t kill you and eat you in Aruba.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Y’know, ever since I ran out on Barry at the wedding, I have wondered whether I made the right choice. And now I know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww… (They hug)
(Joey enters and looks on approvingly.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Big day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’ll give you this, Mr. Peanut is a better dresser. I mean he’s got the monocle, he’s got the top hat…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know he’s gay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanna clarify this: are you outing Mr. Peanut?

content.speaker: Danielle
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Danielle! Hi! Uh- everybody, this is Danielle, Danielle, everybody.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi. Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Danielle
content.text: Well, I’ve been calling you, but it turns out I had your number wrong. And when I finally got the right one from Information, there was no answer. So I thought I’d just come down here, and make sure you were okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …I’m, I’m okay.

content.speaker: Danielle
content.text: Listen uh, maybe we could get together later?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That sounds good. I’ll call you- or you call me, whatever…

content.speaker: Danielle
content.text: You got it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Danielle
content.text: G’bye, everybody.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoo-hoo!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, there you go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Second date!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …I dunno.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t know ?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she seems very nice and everything, but that whole thing about her coming all the way down here, just to see if I was okay? I mean,… how needy is that?
(They all groan and hit him..)
